acqinfo.p: These papers were transferred to the Supreme Court of Virginia Archives from Justice Stephenson's law office in Covington, Virginia, in April 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Roscoe B. Stephenson, Jr., was appointed to the Supreme Court of Virginia in 1981 and reappointed in 1993. He retired in 1997 and served as senior justice until December 2010.

Stephenson was born in Covington, Va., on February 22, 1922. After a brief stint in the army, he was awarded a B.A. degree from Washington and Lee University in 1943 and a J.D. from the Washington and Lee University School of Law in 1947. Stephenson practiced law in Covington and served eight years as Commonwealth's Attorney for Alleghany County. He was a circuit court judge for the 25th Judicial Circuit of Virginia from 1973 to 1981.

As a Supreme Court justice, Stephenson wrote decisions upholding the cap on awards on medical malpractice cases and affirming the use of DNA evidence in the case of Timothy W. Spencer in 1989. The Spencer case was the first case in which a man was sentenced to death based largely on DNA evidence. Stephenson died on May 30, 2011, in Covington, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The papers are comprised mostly of case files, dockets, and other papers documenting Stephenson's tenure as a justice on the Supreme Court of Virginia, 1981-1997; also included are papers documenting Stephenson's earlier career as a lawyer and judge in Covington, Va.; papers documenting the law career of Stephenson's father, Roscoe Bolar Stephenson, Sr., also in Covington, Va., 1910-1945, circa; and the military discharge record of Stephenson's grandfather, Oscar Stephenson, from the army of the Confederate States of America, 1865.
